title: Trump ramps up pressure on Iran by deploying aircraft carrier and threatening strikes
subhed: The US president ordered Tehran to reach a nuclear agreement or face 'far worse' attacks than those of June 2025. Washington continues to concentrate military assets in the Gulf.
byline: By Ghazal Golshiri, Elise Vincent and Chloé Hoorman

title: PFAS: Pollution in the EU could cost up to €1.7 trillion
byline: By Stéphane Horel and Raphaëlle Aubert

title: Starmer's China visit symbolizes Western leaders' shift amid unease with Trump
French groups decry end of Gaza asylum program for artists and scientists
subhed: French organizations say they have been told they are no longer eligible for the Pause program run by the Collège de France, and are urging the government to reverse what they call a 'discriminatory' decision.

title: Fed halts rate cuts amid dollar plunge and pressure from Trump
subhed: On Wednesday, the US Federal Reserve kept its key interest rates steady between 3.5% and 3.75%. The dollar hit its lowest point since 2022.

title: Ali Akbar, Paris's last newspaper hawker, honored by Macron
subhed: The French president presented Ali Akbar with one of the French government's highest honors on Wednesday evening. Akbar has sold Le Monde for decades in the Saint-Germain-des-Prés neighborhood of Paris.

title: At the Paris Opera, Ralph Fiennes brings refined pleasures to 'Eugene Onegin'
subhed: The new production of Tchaikovsky's lyrical masterpiece received a standing ovation at the Palais Garnier, notably showcasing Ukrainian tenor Bogdan Volkov as Lensky.

title: Danish PM cites 'some lessons learned' by EU from Trump's Greenland threats
Rubio tells Senate 'significant progress' in Venezuela since Maduro abduction
How Macron and Lecornu learned to govern without a majority
byline: By Mariama Darame and Nathalie Segaunes

title: 2026 FIFA World Cup: Los Angeles mayor urges the Trump administration to reassure international fans
Havana, a ghost town battered by shortages and US threats
China executes 11 linked to Myanmar online scam gangs
French Sénat adopts a bill to ease the return of colonial-era artifacts to their countries of origin
Escaped Syrian detainees recount chaos after Kurdish forces withdraw
byline: By Hélène Sallon (Deir Ezzor province (Syria), special correspondent)

title: Sweden lowers criminal responsibility to age 13
Denmark's long and difficult reckoning with America's abandonment
Charles Kushner, Trump's man in Paris
'For sure': Two impromptu words by Macron go viral
Work-related cancers remain a blind spot in France's public health system
subhed: A study conducted by doctors and occupational sociologists at the Avignon Hospital Center on over 500 lymphoma patients found there was a 'massive underestimation' of work-related cancers in France.
byline: By Stéphane Foucart (Avignon, southern France, special correspondent)

title: How India and the EU created a common market to counter Trump
subhed: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi and representatives of the European Union concluded a trade agreement on January 27, after nearly 20 years of intermittent negotiations, opening up a market of nearly two billion people.
byline: By Carole Dieterich (New Delhi (India) correspondent) and Virginie Malingre (Brussels, Europe bureau)

title: 'The Wizard of the Kremlin'
subhed: Olivier Assayas's film, adapted from Giuliano da Empoli's eponymous book, was shot in Latvia, where the costly project encountered unexpected financial obstacles and faced criticism over what was seen as an overly positive portrayal of Russian figures.

title: The need to speak truth about immigration
